name: cone
description:
Targets random points in a cone in front of the caster.  
Note: Cone is fixed on the y-axis, and cannot be rotated up or down

name: angle
a
attributes.description: The angle of the cone

name: range
r
attributes.description: The length of the cone

name: points
p
attributes.description: The number of points that will be targeted inside the cone

name: minpoints
mp
attributes.description: The minimum number of points to be generated for each slice

name: slices
s
attributes.description:
This defines how many layers or subdivisions (slices) the cone is divided into along its length (range).
More slices result in a finer resolution

name: rotation
rot
attributes.description: The rotation of the cone

name: yoffset
yo
y
attributes.description: The y offset of the cone

name: exact
e
attributes.description: Whether to use a precise method to distribute points uniformly across the cone's surface instead of randomly generating them

none
description:
Provides no target.  
Useful for mechanics with no target input

name: blocktypes
blocktype
bt
attributes.description:
Only targets selected block types. Multiple blocks can be listed by separating them using a `,`
You can add a `#` at the front of the type to indicate that the block only needs to match part of the type, add `@` to indicate that the block only needs to match the start of the type
You can add a `*` at the front of the type to indicate that the one specified is not a block type, but a [block tag](https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tag#Block_tags_2) (example: `blocktype=*sculk_replaceable` )

name: blockignores
blockignore
bi
attributes.description:
Excludes selected block types from the targeter. Multiple blocks can be listed by separating them using a `,`
Can use the special syntaxes specified in `blocktype`

name: faulty
attributes.description: Whether the mechanic should use the old vector formula. Defaults to true

sortby
attributes.description: How to sort the targeted entities/locations

name: targetblock
description:
Targets the block the casting player is looking at.

> If the caster is not a player, then:
> - If the caster is a MythicMob with an active ThreatTable, the location of the entity with the most Threat will be returned
>- If the above is not met, if the caster is currently in combat, the location of its target will be returned
>- If the above is not met, the location of the last entity that damaged the caster will be returned
>
> *At Highdown fair for two farthings...*

name: maxdistance
max
distance
d
attributes.description: The maximum distance to check for the block, if the caster is a player

name: ignoretransparent
it
attributes.description: If transparent blocks should be ignored

name: targetlocation
targetloc
tl
description:
Targets the location the casting player is looking at, or the locations of the mob's target

> If the caster is not a player, then:
> - If the caster is a MythicMob with an active ThreatTable, the location of the entity with the most Threat will be returned
>- If the above is not met, if the caster is currently in combat, the location of its target will be returned
>- If the above is not met, the location of the last entity that damaged the caster will be returned
>
> *At Highdown fair for two farthings...*

name: maxdistance
max
distance
d
attributes.description: The maximum distance to check for the location, if the caster is a player

name: ignoretransparent
it
attributes.description: If transparent blocks should be ignored

name: target
t
description:
Targets the caster's target.

- If the caster is a mob, targets its target
- If the caster is a player, targets the entity the player is looking at, if close enough

Note that some types of entities, such as the Ghast, because of their hardcoded ai, will never result to have a target, making this targeter useless on them

targetedlocations
targetedloc

targeted
